snippet: The Senate should confirm Mr. Obama’s nominee, the very best choice to lead the Federal Reserve.
abstract: Editorial praises Pres Obama's decision to nominate Janet Yellen as chairwoman of the Federal Reserve; contends Yellen represents continuity with Fed's current policies, and also represents a break from Obama's circle of policy makers whose reputations were marred by their roles before or during the 2008 financial crisis; predicts the Fed will be in good hands under her leadership.
lead_paragraph: The Senate should confirm Mr. Obama’s nominee, the very best choice to lead the Federal Reserve.
